item.title: Manga book pulled from San Bernadino County, CA Libraries
item.dc:creator: Brian Kirsten
item.content:encoded: From ICV2: Bill Postmus, Chairman of the Board of Supervisors of suburban San Bernadino County, California, has ordered the county's libraries to remove the scholarly text Manga: Sixty Years of Japanese Comics from circulation. He proudly announced the move, calling the book "obscene comics," on the county's Website, saying, "That book is absolutely inappropriate for a public library and as soon as I was made aware of it yesterday, I ordered it to be removed immediately." The flap started in Victorville, after a 16-year-old checked the book out of the adult section of the library. The teen's mother "was horrified," according to a story in the local Desert Dispatch, and wrote a letter to the library asking that the book be removed. Read the whole article.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
<strong>Manga Censored At Library</strong>
Pulling Manga: Sixty Years of Japanese Comics off the library shelf doesn't make much sense to me....
